title: Jonas Software Announces the Acquisition of Leonardo Worldwide
content:
Markham, Ontario, November 19, 2018 – Jonas Software (“Jonas”) is pleased to announce that it has acquired Leonardo Worldwide Corporation (“Leonardo”), a leading provider of digital asset management and digital marketing solutions for the global hospitality industry.

“Leonardo, with its long-standing market leadership and deeply experienced team, will expand the depth of the enterprise solutions we have within Jonas’s hospitality portfolio,” said Jim Fedigan, Group CEO of Jonas Club & Hospitality.  “We are very excited to welcome Leonardo’s dedicated customers and employees to our organization.”

“Management is delighted to be part of Jonas and the Constellation Software family, an organization with a successful track record founded on buying, nurturing, and building great vertically-focused software companies and, through the implementation of best practices, will set the foundation for a successful future,” says Mark Charlinski, Chief Executive Officer of Leonardo.  “The Jonas team has extensive experience in supporting software businesses focused on the hospitality industry, ensuring long-term support and success for Leonardo’s customers.”

Advisors

Mooreland Partners LLC served as M&A advisor to Leonardo and Davies Ward Phillips & Vineberg LLP acted as legal counsel to Leonardo.  McCarthy Tétrault LLP acted as legal counsel to Jonas.

About Leonardo Worldwide

Founded in Toronto, Ontario, Canada in 2000, Leonardo helps hotels generate more bookings and revenue, and contributes to better travel experiences by making it easier for guests to select the hotels that meet their needs and expectations. Leonardo’s technology platform lets hotels, hotel chains and management companies showcase their properties and amenities across the web to drive more bookings and revenue. Leonardo has engaged partnerships with global hotel chains, leading travel websites and thousands of hotel properties.

title: Jonas Software Announces the Acquisition of Greycon Ltd.
content:
Wallingford, Oxfordshire, October 12, 2018 – Jonas Software (“Jonas”) is pleased to announce the acquisition of Greycon Ltd. (“Greycon”), a global leader of software solutions for the Paper & Board, Plastic Films & Flexible Packaging, Nonwovens, Metals and Converting industries.

Scott Saklad, Group CEO of Jonas UK, had this to say, “We are very excited to acquire Greycon, a world leader in providing a suite of rolled materials optimisation solutions that help manufacturers streamline their production processes and increase customer service. With a presence in four different continents, acquiring Greycon gives Jonas immediate credibility and authority in the paper, plastic film, nonwoven and metals verticals around the world. We look forward to working with the team at Greycon to continue to provide innovative solutions to help their customers flourish and strategically expand into new markets. Please join me in welcoming the Greycon team to the Jonas family!”

“The acquisition of Greycon is an outstanding milestone and recognition of our team’s hard work, innovations, commitment and successes over the last 30+ years,” says Dr. Constantine Goulimis, CEO of Greycon. “Jonas’s mission and values align with our strategic vision and goals, our belief to provide optimal customer service and take care of our employees. We are excited to join Jonas and leverage their expertise in operating vertical market software. We look forward to continuing to build and innovate the most dynamic software solutions for our customers.

About Greycon Ltd.

Founded in 1985 from the Industrial Systems Group of Imperial College of the University of London, Greycon is the world’s leading provider of production planning, scheduling, forecasting and manufacturing execution systems, which are designed specifically for roll-based & flat sheet industries. Greycon’s founders, Alex Dimitriadis, Prof. Greyham Bryant, and Dr Constantine Goulimis, have taken Greycon throughout the world with 500 sites in over 40 countries. With solutions such as X-Trim, GreyconMill, opt-Studio and Greycon Forecasting, companies can achieve new success and growth like never before.
Greycon is the recent recipient of the Queen’s Award for Enterprise in International Trade for their successful overseas expansion.

title: Jonas Software Announces the Acquisition of Chameleon Software Pty Ltd.
content:
South Brisbane, August 8, 2018 – Jonas Software (“Jonas”) is pleased to announce the acquisition of Chameleon Software Pty Ltd. (“Chameleon”). Chameleon’s flagship product, Case Manager, is the leading case management system for the rehabilitation industry in Australia.  It allows customers to securely communicate, administer, manage, bill, and integrate case management, with the added flexibility of being able to access Case Manager on any device at any time. 

Jeff McKee, Group CEO of Jonas Australia & New Zealand, had this to say: “Chameleon is a great acquisition for our expanding Case Management and Healthcare portfolios. We are excited to continue a journey that Lisa and David embarked upon over 20 years ago. We continue to be impressed with the product and market vision of the Chameleon employees and believe they are a great addition to the team, and I would like to welcome all of our new employees and customers.”

“We are very excited that Chameleon has become a part of the Jonas group” say co-founders Lisa Holley and David Leckenby. “Their long term vision and ‘hold forever’ strategy resonated with us and is a great fit for customers and employees. Our customers rely on our ability to adapt and evolve with constant change and industry trends, and Jonas’s resources and support will help us to continue to exceed their expectations.”

About Chameleon Software Pty Ltd.

Chameleon was founded in Perth, Australia in 1993 and is now run out of Coffs Harbour in New South Wales. Chameleon’s core product, Case Manager, was developed with a goal to provide technology solutions to improve productivity and efficiencies in the rehabilitation industry. Today, Case Manager is more than just a case management tool; with a customer base spreading across Australia, the United States and the United Kingdom, users are enjoying the functionality Case Manager has to offer with a sophisticated information management system incorporating integrated accounting and reporting capabilities.

title: Jonas Software Announces the Acquisition of XLerant, Inc.
content:
Toronto, Ontario, March 30, 2018 – Jonas Software (“Jonas”) is pleased to announce the acquisition of substantially all the assets of XLerant, Inc. (“XLerant”), a leading provider of cloud-based budgeting, forecasting and reporting solutions software. XLerant’s premier product, BudgetPak, is designed to facilitate collaborative, decentralized budgeting and has been recognized for outstanding usability, quick implementation and exceptional support.

“We are very excited about the acquisition of XLerant. XLerant offers budgeting, forecasting and reporting software solutions that enable finance teams to make effective strategic decisions and help organizations prosper. With a strong customer base in the higher education, business services and nonprofit sectors, XLerant is a great addition to Jonas’ portfolio,” said Mike Korbel, General Manager at Jonas.

“We are very pleased to be acquired by, and to join, the Jonas family,” said Joanne E. Brunn, CEO of XLerant. “This partnership provides us with an amazing opportunity to expand and execute on our vision – to help organizations easily and effectively engage their employees in budgeting for a more accurate bottom line.  We look forward to this next chapter and the opportunity to help our customers achieve their goals.”

About XLerant, Inc.

title: Jonas Software Announces the Acquisition of MembersFirst Inc.
content:
Markham, ON Canada Aug. 24, 2015 – Jonas Software, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc. (TSX: CSU), today announces the acquisition of MembersFirst Inc. MembersFirst has grown to become the private club industry’s leading digital agency – offering design, consulting, training, analytics, and member communication solutions to over 1,000 leisure clubs, business associations, gated communities, neighbourhood groups, and others.

The acquisition will retain MembersFirst as an independently operated brand – including its entire team of private club experts and award-winning designers, all of whom are dedicated to servicing clients across a wide range of membership management and back-office platforms.

The acquisition makes MembersFirst the first full-service digital agency under the Jonas umbrella, complimenting existing Jonas Club Software offerings, as well as creating new opportunities in areas not served by Jonas’ ClubHouse Online Website & Member Communication platform. MembersFirst CEO, Kevin Kopanon, said

Being welcomed into the Jonas family is clear validation that we’ve been doing the right things these past few transformative years. More importantly, it will bring improved integrations for our mutual clients and more opportunities to be an advocate for the club industry.

Jim Fedigan, President of Jonas Club Software commented, “We are committed to working with the brightest people this industry has to offer and to developing the solutions needed by clubs today, tomorrow, and in the many years to come. That’s what makes MembersFirst another great fit in the Jonas family of club companies.”

For more information, view our Jonas + MembersFirst FAQ.

About MembersFirst

MembersFirst is an award-winning digital agency & software provider for member-based organizations, including country clubs, yacht clubs, gated community HOAs, alumni associations, and other private recreational clubs. Through extensive in-house services and a strategic network of technology partners, MembersFirst is the only single-source vendor to offer effective web & print design, value-proven marketing services, cinematic video production, and intelligent software that spans the gamut from simple court reservations to enterprise-level performance reporting.

Worldwide over 2,300 clubs in more than 17 countries, with memberships ranging from 100 to 20,000, utilize Jonas Software to build and enrich member relationships, increase revenues, and decrease costs.

title: Jonas Club Software Announces Partnership With CSI globalVCard
content:
CSI Enterprises, a leading provider of electronic payment solutions, has joined forces with Jonas Club Software, the leading provider of software, communications and service solutions to the Club industry.  This exclusive integration partnership in the club management software industry enables Jonas users to automate payments and replace costly paper checks with the globalVCard® virtual card payment system.

Within the Jonas Club Management software system, globalVCard is now offered as a payment type, enabling customers to pay vendors via a secure, single-use virtual card number. The electronic system mirrors the current AP workflow and approval process and allows for easier reconciliation.

“We are always seeking to introduce new tools that will help our clients achieve greater levels of success by improving efficiencies and generating new revenues,” said Jim Fedigan, President of Jonas Club Software. “Our partnership with CSI promises to bring not only significant cost savings and efficiencies but also assurance that our clients benefit from the extraordinary level of customer service that CSI extends to all of its clients.”

The integration brings the following key benefits to Jonas Club Software clients:

  • Security – Because the single-use credit card number is issued for a single transaction, the number becomes invalid once the transaction is complete, thereby eliminating the risk of stored credit card numbers being hacked.
  • Cost savings – virtual cards eliminate paper checks and the costs that go with them, estimated to cost a business up to $20 per check.
  • Speed – through the system integration, payments are completely automated, significantly increasing efficiencies and eliminating the risk of manual error
  • New revenue – customers earn monthly cashback rewards based on virtual card transactions

“Our partner ecosystem is continued to be strengthened through partners like Jonas Club Software, where new verticals now have broader access to our turnkey payments solutions,” said Keith Stone, President and CEO of CSI Enterprises. “The team behind Jonas Club Software is exceptional, and the synergies we share between our companies, our culture and our vision, provide a great foundation for long-term success.”

About CSI Enterprises, Inc.

For 25 years, CSI Enterprises has provided innovative payment solutions to world-leading brands, while providing the highest level of customer service. The company’s highly secure financial payment products include the globalVCard® virtual payment solutions and award-winning mobile applications, corporate purchasing cards, and business fleet fueling/maintenance payment cards. Businesses rely on CSI’s products to reduce costs and increase profits in all areas of B2B payments, including accounts payable, business travel spending and fuel purchases.

About Jonas Club Software

title: Jonas Software Acquires Club Solutions
content:
Gary Jonas Computing Ltd. (“Jonas”) announced today that it has completed the acquisition of substantially all the business assets of Club Solutions from Fiserv, Inc. (“Fiserv”). The acquisition of Club Solutions further expands Jonas’ presence in the fitness, sports and leisure vertical.

“Club Solutions from Fiserv has established itself as a leader in providing fully integrated enterprise software and payment solutions in the fitness, sports and leisure industry,” said Barry Symons, CEO of Jonas. “Adding Club Solutions to our rapidly growing Fitness, Sports and Leisure Business Unit further strengthens our place in this important market and we are very excited to welcome the Club Solutions, customers and employees, to our organization.”

“Club Solutions pioneered management software for the health club industry, and has a talented team of associates who are committed to the success of club clients,” said Jardon Bouska, Division President, Biller Solutions at Fiserv. “We believe the clients and associates of Club Solutions will be well-served by Jonas’ focus on the health and fitness industry.”

The Club Solutions assets acquired in this transaction will become part of a new company called Jonas Fitness, Inc (“Jonas Fitness”). Adam Zeitsiff, who also serves as the Business Unit Manager for the Fitness, Sports and Leisure Division of Jonas in North America, will assume the role of President of Jonas Fitness. and will be responsible for executing all aspects of the company’s future growth and expansion.

“This acquisition represents a unique opportunity for Jonas to solidify its position as a market leader in software and billing services across a wide range of customers in the fitness industry,” said Zeitsiff. “At the same time, we are excited to welcome new employees into our company who are forward-thinking, intelligent and highly dedicated people that will add significant value to our organization. I’m looking forward to working closely with the team on a daily basis as Jonas Fitness emerges into the market.”

A new website for Jonas Fitness is being launched in mid-March and can be found at: www.jonasfitness.com.

About Fiserv

Fiserv, Inc. (NASDAQ: FISV) is a leading global technology provider serving the financial services industry, driving innovation in payments, processing services, risk and compliance, customer and channel management, and business insights and optimization.

About Jonas Software

Jonas Software is a leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to a number of vertical markets, including a leadership position in the global Fitness, Sports and Leisure vertical. title: EZFacility Acquires Frontline Solutions
content:
EZFacility, Inc. (a division of Jonas Software), a global leader in software, management, billing and collections services for businesses in the Fitness, Sports & Leisure industries, is pleased to announce the purchase of certain assets of Frontline Solutions, LLC. With headquarters in Wayne, PA, Frontline Solutions is a leading provider of integrated point-of-sale, scheduling and ticketing software for the rink and family entertainment centre markets.

“We are very proud to welcome Frontline Solutions to our industry-leading portfolio of scheduling and management software platforms for the fitness, sports and leisure industries”, comments Adam Zeitsiff, Chief Executive Officer of EZFacility. “Frontline has long been a leading player in their industry, boasting an impressive base of some of the most respected rink facilities across the country. Everyone at EZFacility looks forward to working with the Frontline team in order to expand their presence in the rink and family entertainment markets across North America. We welcome their employees and customers to our family, and look forward to continued success together.”

Todd Browning, President of Frontline Solutions added, “Being part of a much larger organization gives our customers and employees resources that previously were not available to them. The benefits of Frontline joining EZFacility are tremendous; this combination will give Frontline the capabilities to improve all aspects of our day-to-day operation as well as expanding our rink and family entertainment center product line. I am certain that our customers, employees and prospects will benefit immensely.”

EZFacility will continue to promote and build the Frontline Solutions brand in the rink and family entertainment center markets, and is fully committed to the future investment and development of their software and services. Todd Browning will continue providing his leadership and vision to Frontline Solutions as their President, reporting directly to EZFacility’s CEO, Adam Zeitsiff.

About EZFacility

EZFacility, a division of Jonas Software, Inc., is a global leader in SaaS-based scheduling, management, membership, billing and financial solutions for health and fitness clubs, sports & recreation facilities, personal training studios, martial arts studios, colleges and universities, and numerous other fitness and sports-based businesses. The company is headquartered in Bethpage, New York, has offices in Pennsylvania, Denver, Vancouver, England and Australia, and supports over 5,500 customer facilities and hundreds of thousands of users in over a dozen countries around the globe.

About Frontline Solutions

Frontline Solutions, founded in May 1997 and headquartered in Wayne, Pennsylvania, specializes in the development and implementation of software for the rink, sports, recreation and attractions industry. Frontline’s point-of-sale and customer service management software integrates all areas of business operations into one solution. Frontline Solutions offers installation, training, and support services to facilitate the use of its software.

About Jonas Software

Jonas is a leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to a number of vertical markets, including Club, Foodservice, Construction, Leisure Fitness & Sports, Attractions, Metal Service Centers, Moving & Storage, Education, and Radiology/Laboratory Information Systems industries. Within these nine vertical markets, Jonas boasts 28 distinct brands, all of which are respected and longstanding leaders within their own domain.

title: Member Solutions has acquired Volo Innovations
content:
Member Solutions, a leading provider of full-service membership billing, and web-based applications for front-desk member management, online event registration, credit card processing, and member communication announced today that it has acquired Volo Innovations, a provider of online scheduling and business management applications to the health and fitness industry. Member Solutions is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Jonas Software.

The Volo Innovations acquisition expands Jonas’ presence in the fitness market and increases its strength in the personal training, sports therapy, and boot camp segments. Jonas Software delivers targeted software solutions to a variety of vertical markets including fitness, sports and leisure in the US, Canada, UK, Australia and South Africa. Volo joins a growing set of Jonas family fitness brands including Member Solutions, EZFacility, SDA Solutions, The Retention People, and eFit Financial.

“Adding the Volo online application further strengthens our suite of web-based solutions that help fitness professionals run better businesses by focusing on what they enjoy. Member Solutions will continue to promote and build the Volo brand through continued investment and product development. We welcome the Volo team to our company and look forward to continuing the strong growth of our companies,” said Steven Pinado, CEO of Member Solutions.

Volo Innovations CEO Nikki Lawton stated, “Joining with Member Solutions allows Volo to expand our service offerings. We look forward to adding full-service billing to our already industry-leading billing and invoicing options. Working with Member Solutions and the Jonas family will provide Volo with the opportunity for our clients to utilize additional services that will help them grow their businesses. We are excited to be working with Steven and the Member Solutions team.”

About Member Solutions

Member Solutions has built its business on an unwavering commitment to serving clients in the Martial Arts and related fitness categories. The company operates a propriety payment processing platform and is the leading provider of billing, servicing, and business support to more than 2,500 membership businesses in the United States, Canada, and Australia. The company also offers web-based applications for front-desk member management and online event registration that are fully integrated with its PCI-Compliant payment processing platform.

About Volo Innovations

Volo Innovations is a technology developer and vendor of online business management solutions via Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) technology. Founders Nikki Layton and Barry Duncan have translated their combined 20 years of experience in the health and fitness industry into software design that has an inherent respect for real-world situations and practical usability. Volo Innovations is based in Vancouver, Canada.

title: EZFacility Acquires eFit Financial
content:
Bethpage, New York, (May 11, 2010) – EZFacility. (a division of Jonas Software), a global leader in scheduling, management and membership software solutions for health and fitness clubs, sports facilities, personal training studios, is pleased to announce the purchase of all the shares of eFit Financial. With headquarters in Denver, eFit Financial is a leading provider of SaaS-based, full-service billing, collections and finance management for mid-market health clubs, personal training centres and fitness studios.

“We are very pleased to announce the acquisition of eFit Financial, and happily welcome eFit’s employees and customers to the EZFacility family”, comments Adam Zeitsiff, Chief Executive Officer of EZFacility. “eFit has developed a robust, full-service billing and financial services platform, along with a stellar reputation throughout the fitness industry. We will look to leverage their technical, financial, and customer support expertise to strengthen our competitive position across the fitness, sports and recreation segments. This acquisition truly bolsters our position in these markets and provides us with a valuable foundation for which to accelerate our future growth.”

“I am very pleased to find a company that shares our outlook of providing valuable services to the health and fitness industry with a high level of integrity”, comments John Chalk, Founder, President and CEO of eFit Financial. “We have always strived to create a powerful suite of products that the health club owner can access inexpensively, yet offers unlimited growth potential through a service that they can rely on. As a part of EZFacility, our goal is to continue assisting the industry with top-notch service provided by feature-rich software solutions and dedicated customer service professionals.”

“The addition of eFit provides us with a leading position in full-service billing and financial services for fitness and sports facilities” commented Jeffrey McKee, VP of Business Development and CFO of EZFacility and Jonas Software. “The ability to offer an enterprise-class scheduling, management and membership software solution with the option of integrated billing and hands-on finance support, will result in a best-in-class offering for our customers.”

EZFacility will continue to promote and build the eFit brand and is fully committed to the future investment and development of its products and financial services. The entire eFit team in their Denver office will remain with the company and help contribute to its future growth. John Chalk will continue providing his founding vision to eFit and will assist in the integration of the software, billing and service offerings of both companies.

About EZFacility

EZFacility, a division of Jonas Software, Inc., is a global leader in SaaS-based scheduling, management, membership, billing and financial solutions for health and fitness clubs, sports & recreation facilities, personal training studios, colleges and universities, and numerous other fitness and sports-based businesses. The company is headquartered in Bethpage, New York, has offices in England and Australia, and supports over 1,400 customer facilities and 35,000 users in over a dozen countries around the globe. Visit EZFacility on the web at www.ezfacility.com.

About Jonas Software

Jonas Software is the leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to the Club, Foodservice, Construction, Attractions & Leisure, Fitness & Sports, Metal Service Centers, and Moving & Storage industries. Within these seven vertical markets, Jonas boasts 12 distinct brands, all of which are respected and longstanding leaders within their own domain.

title: Jonas Club Management Announces Strategic Partnership with ClubPay
content:
Jonas Club Management is proud to announce a strategic partnership with ClubPay, a leading provider of outsourced payroll solutions to the club industry. Recognizing the demand for outsourced payroll solutions, in addition to in house payroll processing, which Jonas Club Management already offers, the companies have partnered in order to offer an integrated service solution. 

ClubPay offers best of class solutions for payroll outsourcing, integrated HR management, time and attendance, biometric time clocks, compliance tools and online applicant tracking.  All solutions seamlessly communicate with each other and are customized to meet the unique requirements of the Club industry. ClubPay solutions are flexible and can scale to meet the needs of any size club, from 25 to over 1,000 employees.

“We are tremendously excited to be able to offer this new solution to our clients,” said Barry Symons, CEO of Jonas Software. He continued, “While we have offered a premium in-house Payroll solution to our clients for a number of years, we also recognize that there will always be a number of clubs who prefer to outsource their payroll needs.

Taking this into account, and keeping in line with our commitment to provide the most comprehensive solutions to the Club Market, we are proud to offer ClubPay solutions to our clients” Jonas Club Management clients who are interested in learning more about ClubPay can contact Steve Cowan at 1-888-789-9073 ext. 2380.

Are you interested in learning more about joining the Jonas family? Get in touch with us for more information.

title: Jonas Software Announces the Launch of ClubHouse Online e3
content:
Jonas Software, the Club Industry’s leading provider of software solutions, announces the launching of a new, interactive website solution.

The Vision of ClubHouse Online e3

ClubHouse Online e3, the new online solution from Jonas Software, comes equipped with a robust content management system that is carefully focused on helping clubs to achieve 3 key objectives:

• Engage Your Members: Strengthen the relationships between your members and the club by enabling members to make a variety of online reservations, join groups, and network among their peers.

• Enhance Your Member Communications: Utilize the ability to publish content according to a schedule. A variety of menuing options ensure communications are both relevant and readily available.

• Enrich Your Member Experience: Host a professionally designed website, catering to the needs of members and guests, alike.

Our Fullest-Featured Web Solution for Your Club’s Enhanced Marketing Presence

With applications geared specifically toward meeting these objectives, ClubHouse Online e3’s feature set includes tighter integration to both the Jonas and clubsystems group club management systems, online registrations, scheduled content publication, advanced security settings, and search engine optimization – all of which successfully heighten clubs’ online marketing presence.

title: Jonas Software acquires EZFacility
content:
Jonas Software, a global leader in providing club management solutions to the country, golf, yacht and city club industry, is pleased to announce the purchase of all the assets of EZFaclility Inc “EZFacility”, a leading provider of scheduling, management and membership software solutions for sports facilities, personal training studios, and health and fitness clubs.

“The addition of EZFacility.com provides us with a leading position within the multi-sport facility, sports training, personal training and fitness segments” commented Jeffrey McKee CFO Jonas Software. “We have been interested in the fitness vertical for quite some time now, and EZFacility.com provides the best-in-class Software as a Service (Saas) offering in this space. We welcome them into the Jonas family and look forward to working with them to continue building on their track record of success.”

EZFacility.com President, Adam Zeitsiff stated “The entire EZFacility team is excited to be joining the Jonas Software family. Having a company that understands niche market software with a long track record of success such as theirs presents a unique opportunity for our customers, our employees and our business partners. Their expertise will help accelerate our growth plans and take us to the next level in both the North American and European markets. We look forward to expanding our footprint, adding to our industry-leading products, and continuing to provide fanatical service and support to our global base of customers.”

Jonas will continue to promote and build the EZFacility brand and is fully committed to the future investment and development of their products and services. The entire EZFacility.com team in both their US and European offices will remain with the company and help contribute to its future growth. Adam Zeitsiff will become the Chief Executive Officer of this new division of Jonas Software and will report to Barry Symons, CEO at Jonas Software.

“We are very pleased to add EZFacility.com to the overall Jonas portfolio,” explained Jonas CEO, Barry Symons. “We will look to leverage our technical expertise and other synergies to strengthen our competitive position across all segments, and to ensure our customers continue to receive best in its class service and leading-edge products. Our entrant into the fitness industry with EZFacility.com provides us with a significant opportunity for growth within this vertical.”
EZ Facility will continue operations from their existing offices in New York, London and Amsterdam, and will operate as a separate business unit of Jonas Software.
